Token.Abstract: The FRLayeredNavigationController class implements a container view controller that manages the navigation of hierarchical content. This class is not intended for subclassing.
Initializes and returns a newly created layered navigation controller.

Parameter.Name: rootViewController
Parameter.Abstract: The view controller that resides at the bottom of the navigation stack.

Token.Abstract: Initializes and returns a newly created layered navigation controller. Does the same as initWithRootViewController: but has the ability to configure some parameters for the root view controller.

Parameter.Name: rootViewController
Parameter.Abstract: The view controller that resides at the bottom of the navigation stack.

Parameter.Name: configuration
Parameter.Abstract: A block object you can use to control some parameters (such as the width) for the root view controller. The block's only parameter is an instance of FRLayeredNavigationItem .

Token.Abstract: Pops the top view controller from the navigation stack and updates the display.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Set this value to YES to animate the transition. Pass NO if you are setting up a layered navigation controller before its view is displayed.

Token.Abstract: Pops all the view controllers on the stack except the root view controller and updates the display.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Set this value to YES to animate the transition. Pass NO if you are setting up a layered navigation controller before its view is displayed.

Token.Abstract: Pops view controllers until the specified view controller is at the top of the navigation stack.

Parameter.Name: vc
Parameter.Abstract: The view controller until which to pop.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Set this value to YES to animate the transition. Pass NO if you are setting up a layered navigation controller before its view is displayed.

Token.Abstract: Pushes a view controller onto the stack on top of anchorViewController and updates the display. All view controllers already on top of anchorViewController get popped automatically first.

Parameter.Name: viewController
Parameter.Abstract: The UIViewController to push on the navigation stack.

Parameter.Name: anchorViewController
Parameter.Abstract: The UIViewController on top of which the new view controller should get pushed.

Parameter.Name: maxWidth
Parameter.Abstract: YES if viewController is a content view controller and should therefore use all the remaining screen width.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Set this value to YES to animate the transition. Pass NO if you are setting up a layered navigation controller before its view is displayed.

Token.Abstract: Pushes a view controller onto the stack on top of anchorViewController and updates the display. All view controllers already on top of anchorViewController get popped automatically first.

Parameter.Name: viewController
Parameter.Abstract: The UIViewController to push on the navigation stack.

Parameter.Name: anchorViewController
Parameter.Abstract: The UIViewController on top of which the new view controller should get pushed.

Parameter.Name: maxWidth
Parameter.Abstract: YES if viewController is a content view controller and should therefore use all the remaining screen width.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Set this value to YES to animate the transition. Pass NO if you are setting up a layered navigation controller before its view is displayed.

Parameter.Name: configuration
Parameter.Abstract: A block object you can use to control some parameters (such as the width) for the new view controller. The block's only parameter is an newly created instance of FRLayeredNavigationItem .
